item.title: Notes for Open Course: Deterministic Optimization
Notes for Open Course: Interactive Python Programming
item.description: Notes for the open course - Interactive Python Programming Week 1 - Expressions An easy environment: Codeskulptor Python2 version: http://www.codeskulptor.org Python3 version: http://py3.codeskulptor.org/ Arithmetic Expressions # Arithmetic Expressions - numbers, operators, expressions print(3, -1, 3.14159, -2.8) 3 -1 3.14159 -2.8 # numbers - two types, an integer or a decimal number # two corresponding data types int() and float() print(type(3), type(3.14159)) print(type(3.0)) <class 'int'> <class 'float'> <class 'float'> # we can convert between data types using int() and float() # note that int() takes the 'whole' part of a decimal number # float() applied to integers is boring print(int(3.

item.title: Notes for Open Course: Scentific Writing
item.description: Unit 1 what makes a good writer have something to say logic thinking simple, learnable rules of style to be a better writer read something, pay attention, imitate write in a journal let bad academic writing habits go talking about the research before writing do be boring, be interesting, engage readers stop waiting for special inspiration, begin to write writing is hard, admit it do the first try quickly then revise cut ruthlessly find somebody else to give comments.
